channel.title: VB.NET Form within a form (no MDI)
channel.description:
I never got a reply on this, but eventually I figured our a good way to do it. At least I believe this is a good way.
thread: http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,656620.0.html
What I did was putting a panel on my main form where I wanted my controls. I created another form with the controls I wanted instead of putting the controls on my main form and make them visible/invisible. This allows me to keep my code apart as well as the controls.
Heres the code to load the other form in the panel of the main form.
[code=vbnet]dim otherForm as new FormOtherForm()
otherForm.TopLevel = false
otherForm.visible = true
PanelFromMainForm.Controls.add(otherForm)[/code]
[b]Media:[/b]
[u]Main form:[/u] [img]http://i.imgur.com/5qMUfXR.png[/img]
[u]Form to display within the main form:[/u] [img]http://i.imgur.com/jaMgF0f.png[/img]
[u]End result:[/u] [img]http://i.imgur.com/03NkauE.png[/img]
